signature: static String toLookupKey(final String left, final String separator, final String right)
name: toLookupKey
javadoc:
/**
 * Concatenates three strings with a specified separator in between.
 *
 * @param left  The first string to be concatenated.
 * @param separator  The separator used between the two strings.
 * @param right   The second string to be concatenated.
 * @return A new string containing the concatenation of the input parameters.
 */
improved_javadoc:
/**
 * Concatenates three strings with a specified separator in between, 
 * returning a new string that contains the left and right strings separated by the provided separator.
 *
 * @param left  The first string to be concatenated (left-hand side of the separator).
 * @param separator  The separator used between the two strings.
 * @param right   The second string to be concatenated (right-hand side of the separator).
 * @return A new string containing the concatenation of the input parameters, or null if any of the input parameters are null.
 */

signature: protected String substringAfter(final String value, final String str)
name: substringAfter
javadoc:
/**
 * Returns the substring after the first occurrence of the specified delimiter.
 *
 * @param value the string to get a substring from
 * @param str   the delimiter to search for
 * @return the substring after the first occurrence of the delimiter, or an empty string if no delimiter is found
 */
improved_javadoc:
/**
 * Returns the substring after the first occurrence of the specified delimiter.
 *
 * This method splits the input {@code value} string at the first occurrence of the specified {@code str}
 * delimiter and returns the substring that follows it. If no delimiter is found in the input string,
 * an empty string is returned.
 *
 * @param value  the string to get a substring from
 * @param str    the delimiter to search for
 * @return       the substring after the first occurrence of the delimiter, or an empty string if no delimiter is found
 */

signature: protected String substringAfterLast(final String value, final char ch)
name: substringAfterLast
javadoc:
/**
 * Returns the substring after the last occurrence of the specified character.
 *
 * @param value the string to search in
 * @param ch the character to find
 * @return the substring after the last occurrence of the specified character,
 *         or an empty string if no such character is found
 */
improved_javadoc:
/**
 * Returns the substring that follows the last occurrence of the specified character in the given string.
 *
 * @param value the input string to search in
 * @param ch the target character to find
 * @return the substring after the last occurrence of the specified character, or an empty string if no such character is found
 */
